content:
• Tuesday, September 18, 2012
  • S

    In addition to concerns about Time Warner Cable's plans to sell its stake, Clearwire (CLWR...

    In addition to concerns about Time Warner Cable's plans to sell its stake, Clearwire (CLWR -10.4%) fell today thanks to a bearish note from Morgan Stanley's Simon Flannery, who predicts the debt-laden 4G network/spectrum owner will burn through most of its cash by the end of 2013. He also thinks Clearwire's sales will decline until 2015 due to factors such as Sprint's LTE rollout, adverse pricing, and retail sub losses, and forecasts 2014 and 2015 revenue well below Street estimates.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:50 PM
  • RIOT

    AspenBio Pharma (APPY) says a U.S. District Court has dismissed both a class action lawsuit...

    AspenBio Pharma (APPY) says a U.S. District Court has dismissed both a class action lawsuit against the company and certain of its former or current officers and directors, and the Mark Chipman lawsuit filed against against it. Shares +7.2% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:18 PM
  • DRAD

    Digirad (NASDAQ:DRAD) adds another $2M to its stock buyback program, which was initially adopted...

    Digirad (NASDAQ:DRAD) adds another $2M to its stock buyback program, which was initially adopted in February 2009, now allowing it to purchase an aggregate of $4M of its common stock. Shares +3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:11 PM
  • CTRP

    Ctrip.com (NASDAQ:CTRP) +2.5% AH after announcing a $140M convertible senior note offering its...

    Ctrip.com (NASDAQ:CTRP) +2.5% AH after announcing a $140M convertible senior note offering its management and board will participate in. Ctrip insiders, including its chairman, CEO, CFO, and COO will buy $40M of the notes, which are due 2017 and can be converted into Ctrip shares at an undefined price. The company had $60M of debt on its balance sheet as of June 30. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:14 PM
  • GG

    Goldcorp (NYSE:GG) announces a secondary offering of more than 8.4M common shares of Primero...

    Goldcorp (NYSE:GG) announces a secondary offering of more than 8.4M common shares of Primero Mining (NYSE:PPP) at C$5.25/share, or ~9% of GG's interest in Primero. PPP will not receive any proceeds from the offering. PPP -5.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:01 PM | 1 Comment
  • DNN

    Denison Mines (NYSEMKT:DNN) responds to an +18% jump in its shares today at the request of the...

    Denison Mines (NYSEMKT:DNN) responds to an +18% jump in its shares today at the request of the Toronto Stock Exchange, confirming that there are no material undisclosed corporate developments that might account for the increased trading activity.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM
  • MOH

    Shares of Molina Healthcare (MOH -2.8%) succumb to a downgrade to Underperform on valuation at...

    Shares of Molina Healthcare (MOH -2.8%) succumb to a downgrade to Underperform on valuation at Jefferies, citing the health care provider's high execution risk. Jefferies says its high Medicaid focus is likely to have negative EPS this year.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM
  • ASEI

    American Science & Engineering (ASEI +7.8%) scores a $245M contract for x-ray inspection...

    American Science & Engineering (ASEI +7.8%) scores a $245M contract for x-ray inspection systems from the Department of Homeland Security, more than doubling ASEI's FY 2012 total revenue. Stifel Nicolaus calls the pact a "breakthrough," even as ASEI itself says "while we are very pleased with the award... this is the very early stages of the process."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:51 PM | 1 Comment
  • DLLR

    Shares of DFC Global (DLLR -8%) slide after being downgraded to Hold at Jefferies earlier today....

    Shares of DFC Global (DLLR -8%) slide after being downgraded to Hold at Jefferies earlier today. The firm says its channel checks indicate that regulations in the UK could make collection practices more restrictive in October, and those changes aren't currently priced into the stock. The broker also slashed its price target to $19 from $25.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 PM
  • GPOR

    Gulfport Energy (GPOR -6.6%) gives up some of its ~20% gains from the past two weeks. The...

    Gulfport Energy (GPOR -6.6%) gives up some of its ~20% gains from the past two weeks. The independent energy producer has enjoyed a string of favorable analyst coverage (I, II, III) following Utica shale test results that indicate GPOR has found a sweet spot in the Utica that generates high flow rates and high liquids cuts.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:40 PM
  • WMS-OLD

    WMS Industries (WMS-OLD -6.3%) slides after being cut to Sell on an over-extended valuation by...

    WMS Industries (WMS-OLD -6.3%) slides after being cut to Sell on an over-extended valuation by Deutsche earlier today. The firm notes slowing trends in conversion-kit sales and a weakening of participation pricing for the downgrade. It adds that over-zealous consensus estimates will have to be revised downward, and sentiment toward the industry "is not favorable to say the least."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:19 PM
  • PEIX

    Investors are taking profits in shares of bio-diesel producers after yesterday's Environmental...

    Investors are taking profits in shares of bio-diesel producers after yesterday's Environmental Protection Agency ruling enhancing the amount of biodiesel that must be added into fuel in 2013: PEIX -19.5%, BIOF -10.8%, REGI -6.7%, SYNM -6%, AMRS -5.3%, GEVO -3.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:44 PM | 1 Comment
  • AABA

    Yahoo (YHOO +1.9%) spikes higher after announcing it will return 85% of the cash ($3.65B)...

    Yahoo (YHOO +1.9%) spikes higher after announcing it will return 85% of the cash ($3.65B) obtained from the partial sale of its Alibaba (OTC:ALBCF) stake to shareholders. Yahoo, which adds it still owns 23% of Alibaba, had fallen on worries Marissa Mayer would opt to hold onto most or all of the cash for the sake of pursuing acquisitions. "Marissa got over-lawyered into that 8-K," Eric Jackson opines. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM | 3 Comments
  • PMFG

    PMFG (PMFG +16.9%) is awarded a U.S. Navy contract to provide air inlet moisture...

    PMFG (PMFG +16.9%) is awarded a U.S. Navy contract to provide air inlet moisture separation/filtration systems on the Arleigh Burke class of destroyers. The maker of custom-engineered systems says the five-year contract could have a potential value of $13.7M, if all options are exercised.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM
  • NABI

    Nabi Biopharmaceutical (NABI +2.3%) and prospective merger partner Biota Holdings both agree to...

    Nabi Biopharmaceutical (NABI +2.3%) and prospective merger partner Biota Holdings both agree to revise terms of their deal, providing $27M to be split among NABI shareholders to compensate for Biota's reduced share value since the transaction was announced in April.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:24 PM
  • NAT

    Nordic American Tanker (NAT -1.4%) acquires the remaining 50% shareholding interest in Orion...

    Nordic American Tanker (NAT -1.4%) acquires the remaining 50% shareholding interest in Orion Tanker Pool from Frontline (FRO -9.1%), effective January, 2013. Once the transaction closes, Orion will become a 100% subsidiary of NAT. FRO's nine suezmax vessels will leave Orion later this year after the shipper advised NAT that it wishes to be more flexible in the operation of its vessels.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:19 PM | 8 Comments
  • ANRZQ

    Alpha Natural Resources' (ANR -4%) decision to cut ~15% of its coal output and ~9% of its...

    Alpha Natural Resources' (ANR -4%) decision to cut ~15% of its coal output and ~9% of its workforce was "dramatic" but a function of market reality, as domestic utility demand likely will remain difficult next year and beyond. But overall, it's a positive for ANR and the industry if the U.S. thermal coal market bottoms in 2013 before recovering in 2014, as analysts expect.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:17 PM
  • SRPT

    Sarepta Therapeutics (SRPT +6.5%) moves up after the FDA granted Fast Track approval status for...

    Sarepta Therapeutics (SRPT +6.5%) moves up after the FDA granted Fast Track approval status for it's lead drug candidates, AVI-7288 and AVI-7537, for Ebola and Marburg viruses respectively. Both drugs are being developed under a U.S. Department of Defense contract. AVI-7288 will start an upcoming Phase I multiple ascending dose study, however, development of AVI-7537 remains under a temporary stop-work order due to funding constraints.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:56 PM | 1 Comment
  • BBBY

    Bed Bath & Beyond (BBBY -3%) slips on a downgrade to Perform on valuation at Oppenheimer,...

    Bed Bath & Beyond (BBBY -3%) slips on a downgrade to Perform on valuation at Oppenheimer, citing it's recent rally and an absence of positive catalysts over the near-term.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM

  • A reheated rumor that David Einhorn is short Lululemon (LULU -3.4%) could be behind today's...

    A reheated rumor that David Einhorn is short Lululemon (LULU -3.4%) could be behind today's swing lower, although the rapid-fire 40% gain by shares from last month's low also makes the case that valuation concerns are driving sentiment a bit easier to latch onto.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • STLD

    Steel Dynamics (STLD -3%), Schnitzer Steel (SCHN -1.4%), Reliance Steel (RS -0.7%) and...

    Steel Dynamics (STLD -3%), Schnitzer Steel (SCHN -1.4%), Reliance Steel (RS -0.7%) and Worthington (WOR -1.4%) are downgraded to Hold from Buy at Jefferies, which believes steel shares are fully valued and expects U.S. steel prices to pull back. The firm maintains Buy ratings on the most defensive (NYSE:NUE) and undervalued (GTI, MUSA, ZEUS) names within the group.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM
  • DK

    Delek (DK -6.7%) shares sink on disclosure that its CEO recently sold 144,009 shares at $25...

    Delek (DK -6.7%) shares sink on disclosure that its CEO recently sold 144,009 shares at $25 each, worth ~$3.6M. Also noteworthy: Credit Suisse cuts its rating for DK and refining peers Western Refining (WNR -2.6%), Marathon Petroleum (MPC -3.6%) and Phillips 66 (PSX -2.1%) to Neutral.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM

  • Blackrock Kelso Capital (BKCC -5.1%) dives after Stifel downgrades to Sell: the firm argues...

    Blackrock Kelso Capital (BKCC -5.1%) dives after Stifel downgrades to Sell: the firm argues BKCC, which is valued roughly in-line with its peer group on an earnings yield basis, should trade at a slight discount due to its credit quality history. Also, Stifel doesn't think the money manager will be able to pay its hefty dividend (current yield of 10.6%) merely through its NOI earnings in 2012 or 2013.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:55 AM
  • CRR

    Carbo Ceramics (CRR -1.7%) is downgraded to Hold from Buy at Dahlman Rose, which says it does...

    Carbo Ceramics (CRR -1.7%) is downgraded to Hold from Buy at Dahlman Rose, which says it does not expect shares to rally again until Haynesville activity rebounds. The firm says imports have decreased from record levels but have been more resilient than expected and increased in Q3; higher imports and recent price anecdotes increase EPS uncertainty.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM | 1 Comment

  • France Telecom (FTE -3.9%) slumps after BNP and Bernstein downgrade the carrier to Neutral and...

    France Telecom (FTE -3.9%) slumps after BNP and Bernstein downgrade the carrier to Neutral and Underperform, respectively. Poor mobile services demand, growing competition from upstart Free, and a huge debt load in the midst of the eurozone's crisis have kept FTE's shares sporting a single-digit P/E.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:41 AM

  • AMD (AMD -7.4%) isn't a popular stock with analysts, and the resignation (I, II) of CFO Thomas...

    AMD (AMD -7.4%) isn't a popular stock with analysts, and the resignation (I, II) of CFO Thomas Seifert has given the company's critics another chance to take aim. Jefferies points out AMD's net debt fell from $2B+ to $440M during Seifert's tenure, while Evercore thinks another earnings warning could soon be on the way due to strong competition from Intel and "bloated" CPU inventories. UBS (previous) is worried AMD's cost controls are prevented needed mobile investments.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM | 1 Comment
  • MCGC

    MCG Capital (MCGC -10.6%) shares plunge following a downgrade to Sell at Stifel Nicolaus,...

    MCG Capital (MCGC -10.6%) shares plunge following a downgrade to Sell at Stifel Nicolaus, based on fundamentals and credit quality. The firm says MCGC's difficult credit track record means it should trade at a "meaningful" discount to its peers. Also, after MCGC pays its Q3 dividend, the firm thinks the Q4 dividend will be cut to $0.48/share annually from $0.56/share.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM

  • Shares of Bed, Bath & Beyond (BBBY -2.8%) fall after Oppenheimer cuts its rating on the firm to...

    Shares of Bed, Bath & Beyond (BBBY -2.8%) fall after Oppenheimer cuts its rating on the firm to Perform from Outperform with the retailer's earnings potential a major concern for the near term. Analysts set a $80 price target which still gives their stance on BBBY some room to run.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM
  • NKTR

    Nektar Therapeutics (NKTR +2.1%) says that a Phase 1a clinical study of its drug candidate...

    Nektar Therapeutics (NKTR +2.1%) says that a Phase 1a clinical study of its drug candidate NKTR-192, a short-acting mu-opioid analgesic for the treatment of acute pain, achieved its target pharmacokinetic profile. The company also says that dosing has commenced in a second Phase 1a clinical study which will explore the pharmacodynamic profile of the drug in healthy subjects.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM

  • Youku Tudou (YOKU +5.1%) has been on a roller-coaster the last two days. Shares fell 10%...

    Youku Tudou (YOKU +5.1%) has been on a roller-coaster the last two days. Shares fell 10% yesterday thanks to a Chinese-language article suggesting user overlap for the newly-merged company's video sites could be as high as 50% - well above the 18% recently claimed by a Youku VP. But shares are rebounding a little today after Citi argues the article made incorrect conclusions as a result of comparing monthly data with weekly data.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:12 AM
  • ENR

    Energizer Holdings (ENR +9%) trades higher after announcing it expects to save $175M-$200M a...

    Energizer Holdings (ENR +9%) trades higher after announcing it expects to save $175M-$200M a year after assessing its cost structure and operating model. The battery maker says new initiatives in the works will start accruing in the second half of FY13.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM

  • Shares of Deckers Outdoor (DECK -6.2%) fall again with concerns over Ugg boot sales this season...

    Shares of Deckers Outdoor (DECK -6.2%) fall again with concerns over Ugg boot sales this season still swirling around. As shorts increase their bets, SA author Bill Maurer's cautious approach on the retailer as he waits out earnings looks timely.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:52 AM

  • Rubicon (RBCN +2.3%) gapped higher on an upgrade to Buy from ThinkEquity, but has since given...

    Rubicon (RBCN +2.3%) gapped higher on an upgrade to Buy from ThinkEquity, but has since given back a chunk of its gains. The LED wafer supplier has been in a fairly narrow trading range for months after getting crushed in 2011 due to a weak demand/pricing environment.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 AM
  • MNK

    Oppenheimer raises its price target for Questcor Pharma (QCOR +3%) to $69 from $59 after...

    Oppenheimer raises its price target for Questcor Pharma (QCOR +3%) to $69 from $59 after positive commentary from investor meetings. Investors are becoming more comfortable with QCOR's perceived risks, the firm says, and any additional negative reports will result in limited downside volatility. Acthar reimbursement rates remain “extremely strong,” the firm adds.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:34 AM | 2 Comments
  • VELTF

    Velti (VELT) +10.6% after announcing a $27M, 2-year deal to help run a mobile ad campaign for an...

    Velti (VELT) +10.6% after announcing a $27M, 2-year deal to help run a mobile ad campaign for an unnamed "major U.S. brand." It's a pretty significant deal for Velti, given the company is only expected to generate 2012 revenue of $293M. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:21 AM
  • JIVE

    Jive Software (NASDAQ:JIVE) +2.8% courtesy of an upgrade to Outperform from Wells Fargo. Wells'...

    Jive Software (NASDAQ:JIVE) +2.8% courtesy of an upgrade to Outperform from Wells Fargo. Wells' reasons: Jive is down 50% from its April high; there are "positive secular trends" around consumer-like business apps that foster interaction with customers; and Jive can post 25%-30% annual growth over the next few years as its social networking software is adopted for both internal and customer-facing purposes. UBS upgraded Jive last Thursday.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:12 AM
  • VELTF

    Premarket gainers: VELT +12%. DOLE +7%. TRGT +7%. ROSG-OLD +6%. Losers: AMD -9%. CLWR -6%.

    Premarket gainers: VELT +12%. DOLE +7%. TRGT +7%. ROSG-OLD +6%.
    Losers: AMD -9%. CLWR -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM | 1 Comment
  • LULU

    Shares of Lululemon (NASDAQ:LULU) are on watch as they approach their all-time high of $81.09...

    Shares of Lululemon (NASDAQ:LULU) are on watch as they approach their all-time high of $81.09 again. Traders see any move over $80 as a possible tipping point for a new wave of selling.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:05 AM | 2 Comments
  • CBIO

    Shares of Targacept (TRGT) trade 6.7% higher premarket a day after a Phase 2 trial of the firm's...

    Shares of Targacept (TRGT) trade 6.7% higher premarket a day after a Phase 2 trial of the firm's TC-5619 drug candidate rattled investors. Adam Feuerstein says the company's promising pipeline helps to keep the name interesting to institutional investors.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:59 AM
  • LAMR

    Lamar Advertising (NASDAQ:LAMR) +2.8% premarket after Goldman Sachs upgrades shares to...

    Lamar Advertising (NASDAQ:LAMR) +2.8% premarket after Goldman Sachs upgrades shares to Conviction Buy from Neutral with a $42 price target (up from $34). The firm sees a high probability of IRS approval for LAMR's REIT conversion in Q1 2013 given a recent IRS ruling that established a billboard REIT precedent.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:30 AM
  • UPS

    Shares of UPS fall 1.4% premarket after FedEx's weak outlook for FY13 disappoints. There's no...

    Shares of UPS fall 1.4% premarket after FedEx's weak outlook for FY13 disappoints. There's no getting around that the same "weak economic conditions" FedEx says it faces, will be a drag on UPS.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:54 AM | 2 Comments
  • FDX

    FedEx (NYSE:FDX): FQ1 EPS of $1.45 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $10.8B (+3% Y/Y) beats by $100M....

    FedEx (NYSE:FDX): FQ1 EPS of $1.45 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $10.8B (+3% Y/Y) beats by $100M. Shares -2.7% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:32 AM | 2 Comments
  • DOLE

    Dole Food (NYSE:DOLE) +9.5% premarket after agreeing to sell its worldwide packaged foods and...

    Dole Food (NYSE:DOLE) +9.5% premarket after agreeing to sell its worldwide packaged foods and Asia fresh produce businesses for ~$1.7B in cash to Japan's Itochu, a deal that will help Dole reduce its sizable debt and cut costs. The company also plans to streamline its global personnel and corporate structure to conform to the specific needs of its remaining businesses.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:21 AM
